entry.title: Wind Advisory issued November 10 at 8:49AM PST until November 12 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Hanford CA
entry.summary:
* WHAT...West winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected.
* WHERE...Mojave Desert Slopes.
* WHEN...From 9 PM Monday to 7 AM PST Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highways impacted include, but are not limited to, 14, 58, and 178. Strong crosswinds are possible at times.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 10 at 11:47AM EST by NWS Albany NY
entry.summary:
The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation at Albany has issued a Air Quality Health Advisory for Fine Particulates...until midnight tonight.
Air quality levels in outdoor air are predicted to be greater than an air quality index value of 100 for Fine Particulates. The air quality index...or AQI...was created as an easy way to correlate levels of different pollutants to one scale. The higher the AQI value, the greater the health concern.
When pollution levels are elevated...the New York State Department of Health recommends that individuals consider limiting strenuous outdoor physical activity to reduce the risk of adverse health effects. People who may be especially sensitive to the effects of elevated levels of pollutants include the very young and those with pre existing respiratory problems such as asthma or heart disease. Those with symptoms should consider consulting their personal physician.
For additional information, please visit the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation website at, https://on.ny.gov/nyaqi, or call the Air Quality Hotline at 800-535- 1345.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southern Fulton; Montgomery; Northern Saratoga; Northern Washington; Schoharie; Western Schenectady; Eastern Schenectady; Southern Saratoga; Western Albany; Eastern Albany; Western Rensselaer; Eastern Rensselaer; Western Greene; Eastern Greene; Western Columbia; Eastern Columbia; Western Ulster; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Eastern Dutchess; Northern Fulton; Southern Washington

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 10:49AM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
entry.summary:
Dry fuels will contribute to an elevated risk of fire spread for Delaware and Sullivan counties in NY. Low relative humidity values of 30 to 40 percent and gusty winds of 15 to 25 mph expected through this afternoon. Conditions will improve as rain moves into these counties by late afternoon.
Any outdoor burning is strongly discouraged. Use extra caution if handling any potential ignition sources, such as machinery or matches, and ensure to properly extinguish or dispose cigarette butts. Please refer to the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation web site for information on burn restrictions.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Delaware; Sullivan

cap:parameter.value: ELEVATED RISK FOR FIRE SPREAD THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 10 at 10:49AM EST by NWS Upton NY
entry.summary:
The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Health Advisory for the following counties:
New York, Bronx, Kings, Queens, Richmond, Westchester, Rockland.
until midnight EST Sunday night.
Air quality levels in outdoor air are predicted to be greater than an Air Quality Index value of 100 for the pollutant of Fine Particulates. The Air Quality Index, or AQI, was created as an easy way to correlate levels of different pollutants to one scale. The higher the AQI value, the greater the health concern.
When pollution levels are elevated, the New York State Department of Health recommends that individuals consider limiting strenuous outdoor physical activity to reduce the risk of adverse health effects. People who may be especially sensitive to the effects of elevated levels of pollutants include the very young, and those with preexisting respiratory problems such as asthma or heart disease. Those with symptoms should consider consulting their personal physician.
A toll free air quality hotline has been established so New York residents can stay informed on the air quality situation. The toll free number is 1 800 5 3 5, 1 3 4 5.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Rockland; Northern Westchester; Southern Westchester; New York (Manhattan); Bronx; Richmond (Staten Is.); Kings (Brooklyn); Northern Queens; Southern Queens

cap:parameter.value: AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 10 at 10:25AM EST by NWS Mount Holly NJ
entry.summary:
The New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection has issued an Air Quality Action day for Particulate Matter (PM2.5). Sensitive individuals, including those with heart or lung disease, the elderly, and the young should limit strenuous activities and the amount of time active outdoors. Levels of fine particulates will rise into the Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups (USG) category in isolated areas of northeastern and southern portions of New Jersey today due to wildfire smoke transport from localized wildfires throughout the state. A low pressure system is expected to pass through the region later today, bringing rain showers and southwesterly winds. Additionally, ozone will remain good statewide.
An Air Quality Advisory means that air quality within the region may approach or exceed unhealthy standards. For more information on current and forecast concentrations of ground-level ozone and fine particulates, visit www.airnow.gov or www.state.nj.us/dep/airmon/ or call the New Jersey Bureau of Air Monitoring at 609-292-0138.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Gloucester; Camden; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Coastal Ocean; Southeastern Burlington

cap:parameter.value: AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 11:59PM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
entry.summary:
The Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) has issued a Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert (TCFA) for Invest 94W, meaning development into a tropical cyclone is likely within 24 hours, but Invest 94W continues to move away from Chuuk State and is now northeast of Fais Island in Yap State, near 10.3N 143.1E. Recent satellite imagery shows showers are subsiding across Chuuk State as drier weather spreads across the State. The threat for gusty winds has diminished.
This will be the last Special Weather Statement for Chuuk State in regards to 94W. Visit weather.gov/gum/PublicForecasts for the latest weather information.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chuuk Lagoon

cap:parameter.value: POTENTIAL FOR GUSTY SHOWERS HAS DIMINISHED... ...94W CONTINUES TO PULL AWAY TO THE WEST-NORTHWEST

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 11:59PM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
entry.summary:
The Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) has issued a Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert (TCFA) for Invest 94W, meaning development into a tropical cyclone is likely within 24 hours. Invest 94W is located northeast of Fais Island in Yap State, near 10.3N 143.1E, and matches well with the latest CIMSS tropical vorticity analysis in the 850mb to 500mb layer. Invest 94W is moving west-northeast at 17 knots, with max sustained winds near and just north of the center estimated to be around 20 kt to 25 kt (23 mph to 30 mph). Satellite imagery shows heavy showers and thunderstorms consolidating over the center of 94W, with locally heavy showers and thunderstorms developing near Guam and then near Ulithi and Fais in Yap State, just east of Yap Proper. Though the core of strongest winds are expected to pass north of Yap, gusts around 25 kt (30 mph) are possible near heavier showers and thunderstorms.
Invest 94W will continue west-northwest and strengthen as it passes north of Yap through Monday night, potentially reaching tropical storm strength (sustained maximum winds greater than 33 kts) sometime late Monday night or Tuesday. The forecasted track keeps 94W, along with the strongest winds and showers, north of Yap Proper, Ulithi, and nearby islands as it heads into the Philippine Sea over the next few days, but unsettled weather will likely still be felt across Yap State through Monday night. Locally heavy showers and associated strong wind gusts are possible. Travel between islands will be hazardous at times with gusty winds and choppy seas near thunderstorms.
Folks across Yap State should monitor local weather forecasts the next couple of days from the National Weather Service in Guam, and for additional information from your local Weather Service Office and emergency management. Visit weather.gov/gum/PublicForecasts for the latest weather information from the National Weather Service.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Yap

cap:parameter.value: TROPICAL CYCLONE FORMATION ALERT ISSUED FOR INVEST 94W... ...LOCALLY HEAVY SHOWERS AND GUSTY WINDS POSSIBLE FOR YAP STATE

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 10 at 7:51AM EST until November 10 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Jacksonville FL
entry.summary:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia...
Altamaha River At Charlotteville affecting Toombs, Montgomery and Jeff Davis Counties.
Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/wfo/JAX
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Altamaha River at Charlotteville.
* WHEN...Until late this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Bankfull conditions occur along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the U.S. Highway 221 bridge. Some flooding begins in low lying areas around 1.5 miles upstream from the gage in south Montgomery County. The water will approach portions of Three Rivers Lane...Altamaha River Road and Ogle Sandbar Road. At 13.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs in the woodlands along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the U.S. Highway 221 bridge. The water reaches the top of the public boat ramp by the bridge. Flood waters expand in low lying areas in south Montgomery County around 1.5 miles upstream from the gage. The water will begin to cover portions of Three Rivers Lane...Altamaha River Road and Ogle Sandbar Road. At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the U.S. Highway 221 bridge. The water covers the low portion and entrance of Towns Bluff Lane by the bridge. The public boat ramp is under two feet of water. Flood waters expand further into south Montgomery County around 1.5 miles upstream from the gage. The water will be one to two feet deep over portions of Three Rivers Lane...Altamaha River Road and Ogle Sandbar Road.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 6.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 10 at 5:11AM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
entry.summary:
The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation at Albany has issued a Air Quality Health Advisory for Fine Particulates until midnight EST tonight.
Air quality levels in outdoor air are predicted to be greater than an air quality index value of 100 for Fine Particulates. The air quality index...or AQI...was created as an easy way to correlate levels of different pollutants to one scale. The higher the AQI value, the greater the health concern.
When pollution levels are elevated...the New York State Department of Health recommends that individuals consider limiting strenuous outdoor physical activity to reduce the risk of adverse health effects. People who may be especially sensitive to the effects of elevated levels of pollutants include the very young and those with pre existing respiratory problems such as asthma or heart disease. Those with symptoms should consider consulting their personal physician.
For additional information, please visit the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation website at, https://on.ny.gov/nyaqi, or call the Air Quality Hotline at 800-535-1345.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Sullivan

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 9 at 11:35PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
entry.summary:
ESFSEW
A series of strong and wet Pacific storm systems will track through western Washington next week with sharp rises on the rivers flowing off the Olympics and Cascades. There is little break between each system. As a result, several rivers are forecast to reach Action Stage with Minor flooding possible, especially by Wednesday or Thursday.
Flooding extent will depend on rainfall rates, temperatures, snow levels, and total rainfall with each of these weather systems next week.
Please monitor the latest river forecasts from the National Weather Service for additional information.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Clallam, WA; Grays Harbor, WA; Jefferson, WA; King, WA; Skagit, WA; Snohomish, WA; Whatcom, WA

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 5:07PM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
entry.summary:
A tropical disturbance, known as Invest 94W from the Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC), continues to slowly intensify as it passes south of Guam through Monday. 94W could bring heavy rainfall, gusty winds, and choppy seas and surf, especially across Guam and Rota. In addition, Tropical Storm Man-yi continues to drift west-northwest towards the Marianas and is expected to reach peak intensity Sunday night. Current model guidance favors a gradual weakening of Man-yi to a Tropical Depression (winds less than 39 mph) before a passage north of Saipan near Anatahan Tuesday night into early Wednesday. Still, much uncertainty remains in regards to the exact strength, timing and path of Man-yi. Either way, expect the potential for heavy rainfall, gusty winds, and elevated marine and surf conditions later Tuesday into Wednesday.
POTENTIAL IMPACTS: - Sustained winds 15 to 25 mph gusting to 35 mph in heavier showers and thunderstorms.
- Locally heavy rainfall potentially causing flash flooding.
- Hazardous surf and marine conditions.
For more information on Invest 94W, see bulletins issued by JTWC under WMO header ABPW10 PGTW.
For more information on Tropical Storm Man-yi, see bulletins issued by JTWC under WMO header WTPN32 PGTW and ABPW10 PGTW.
Residents across the Marianas should continue monitoring local weather forecasts from the National Weather Service in Guam, and for additional information from your local Weather Service Office and emergency management. Visit weather.gov/gum/PublicForecasts for the latest weather information from the National Weather Service.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Guam; Rota; Tinian; Saipan

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 4:45PM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
entry.summary:
The Joint Typhoon Warning Center's (JTWC) Invest 94W continues to move west-northwest, spreading scattered to numerous showers and isolated thunderstorms across portions of far western Chuuk State and Yap State. Latest scatterometer and visible satellite imagery suggest 94W is now centered to the north of Faraulep Atoll in eastern Yap State, near 9.2N 144.5E. This is falling better in line with the latest CIMSS tropical vorticity analysis in the 850mb to 500mb layer, as 94W becomes better organized around the northernmost vorticity lobe within the broader elongated trough. Satellite imagery shows moderate to deep convection over a broad area covering portions of western Chuuk State and Yap State, with much of the heavier showers consolidated within the northern periphery of 94W just south of the Marianas. Scatterometry data shows moderate to fresh winds northwest of the circulation center, though gusts around 25 kt (30 mph) are possible near heavier showers and thunderstorms.
Invest 94W looks to continue west-northwest and strengthen as it passes south of the Marianas overnight into Monday. Latest model guidance shows 94W passing near to the north of Yap Proper on Monday through Monday night as it strengthens, potentially reaching tropical storm strength (sustained maximum winds greater than 33 kts) sometime late Monday night or Tuesday. The forecasted track keeps 94W, along with the strongest winds and showers, north of Yap Proper as it heads into the Philippine Sea over the next few days, but unsettled weather will likely still be felt across Yap State, especially tonight through Monday night. Locally heavy showers and associated strong wind gusts are possible. Travel between islands could become hazardous with gusty winds and choppy sea near thunderstorms.
Folks across Chuuk State and Yap State should monitor local weather forecasts the next couple of days from the National Weather Service in Guam, and for additional information from your local Weather Service Office and emergency management. Visit weather.gov/gum/PublicForecasts for the latest weather information from the National Weather Service.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chuuk Lagoon; Yap

cap:parameter.value: MONITORING INVEST 94W IN WESTERN MICRONESIA FOR FURTHER DEVELOPMENT... ...LOCALLY HEAVY SHOWERS AND GUSTY WINDS POSSIBLE FOR YAP STATE AND WESTERN CHUUK STATE

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 10 at 12:01AM EST by NWS Upton NY
entry.summary:
The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Health Advisory for the following counties:
New York, Bronx, Kings, Queens, Richmond, Westchester, Rockland.
until midnight EST Sunday night.
Air quality levels in outdoor air are predicted to be greater than an Air Quality Index value of 100 for the pollutant of Fine Particulates. The Air Quality Index, or AQI, was created as an easy way to correlate levels of different pollutants to one scale. The higher the AQI value, the greater the health concern.
When pollution levels are elevated, the New York State Department of Health recommends that individuals consider limiting strenuous outdoor physical activity to reduce the risk of adverse health effects. People who may be especially sensitive to the effects of elevated levels of pollutants include the very young, and those with preexisting respiratory problems such as asthma or heart disease. Those with symptoms should consider consulting their personal physician.
A toll free air quality hotline has been established so New York residents can stay informed on the air quality situation. The toll free number is 1 800 5 3 5, 1 3 4 5.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Rockland; Northern Westchester; Southern Westchester; New York (Manhattan); Bronx; Richmond (Staten Is.); Kings (Brooklyn); Northern Queens; Southern Queens

entry.summary:
* WHAT...An extended period of stagnant air, with light winds and little vertical mixing. This is due to an inversion near the surface that will continue to trap pollutants.
* WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Idaho and southeast Oregon.
* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST /4 AM PST/ Monday.
* IMPACTS...Poor air quality may cause issues for people with respiratory problems.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Treasure Valley; Boise Mountains; Upper Treasure Valley; Camas Prairie; Harney County; Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 6:11AM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
entry.summary:
Corrected center location based on latest JTWC info.
...MONITORING INVEST 94W IN WESTERN MICRONESIA FOR FURTHER DEVELOPMENT... ...LOCALLY HEAVY SHOWERS AND GUSTY WINDS POSSIBLE FOR EASTERN YAP STATE AND WESTERN CHUUK STATE...
The Joint Typhoon Warning Center's (JTWC) Invest 94W continues to move west-northwest, spreading numerous showers and isolated thunderstorms across western Chuuk State and eastern Yap State. Latest scatterometer and infrared satellite data suggest 94W is centered west-southwest of Chuuk Proper near 6N149E. The latest CIMSS tropical vorticity analysis however, shows mid-level vorticity in the 850mb to 500mb layer is displaced slightly north of the surface circulation, which is likely leading the variability in the forecast track in the models. Satellite imagery shows moderate to deep convection over a broad area covering much of western Chuuk State and eastern Yap State. The overnight scatterometry data shows an area of moderate to fresh winds north of the disorganized circulation center, though gusts around 25 kt (30 mph) are possible near heavier showers and thunderstorms.
This disturbance is favored to continue west-northwest over the next few days, becoming gradually more organized as it shifts south of the Marianas this afternoon into Monday. Latest model guidance shows 94W passing to the north of Yap Proper through Monday night as it strengthens, potentially reaching tropical storm strength (sustained maximum winds greater than 33 kts) sometime late Monday night or Tuesday. The forecasted track keeps 94W north of Yap State as it heads into the Philippine Sea over the next few days, but unsettled weather may still be felt across the eastern outer islands of Yap State and possibly Yap Proper, especially tonight through Monday night. Locally heavy showers and associated strong wind gusts are possible. Travel between islands could become hazardous with gusty winds and choppy sea near thunderstorms.
Folks across Chuuk State and Yap State should monitor local weather forecasts the next couple of days from the National Weather Service in Guam, and for additional information from your local Weather Service Office and emergency management. Visit weather.gov/gum/PublicForecasts for the latest weather information from the National Weather Service.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chuuk Lagoon; Yap

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 9 at 2:28AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
entry.summary:
An Air Quality Alert has been issued by the following agencies:
Idaho Department of Environmental Quality in Coeur d'Alene
...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY FROM THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY FOR Boundary, Bonners, Kootenai, Shoshone, and Benewah Counties...
* WHAT...Air Quality Advisory because of forecast stagnant weather conditions. The Air Quality Index is forecast to be Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups Saturday, and Unhealthy Sunday.
* WHERE...Boundary, Bonners, Kootenai, Shoshone, and Benewah Counties.
* WHEN...Until 10am PST Monday.
* IMPACTS...For unhealthy for sensitive groups, those sensitive may experience health effects. For unhealthy air quality, some members of the general public may experience health effects. Members of sensitive groups may experience more serious health effects.
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS
Air pollutants can cause breathing difficulties for children, the elderly, as well as persons with respiratory problems. Those individuals who are sensitive to increased particulate matter or smoke are encouraged to avoid prolonged or strenuous outdoor activity during this advisory. Open burning is prohibited by air quality rule. It is also recommended that all other individuals limit prolonged or strenuous activity outdoors.
This statement is issued by the Idaho Department of Environmental Quality, Air Quality Group. For more information...contact DEQ's Coeur d'Alene Regional Office at (208) 769-1422.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Benewah, ID; Bonner, ID; Boundary, ID; Kootenai, ID; Shoshone, ID
